title: Associate Content Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was excellent. The people were extremely friendly. She immediately put me at ease. The questions were not only direct. They made an effort to learn about me. They also responded quickly.
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself
what do you know about CMS

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UOIT
Interview Descriptions: It was a bit confusing as the prof was not sure how many positions he might have. It was also a bit stressful as he was keeping asking if I am sure I could do the job over and over!
Interview Questions: It was a normal interview asking about my experiences and what I have done before.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UOIT
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick. You send in your resume to the portal and an interested professor will reach out to you but it is better to reach out to a professor YOURE interested in directly.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you lead a team

title: Contracts Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Effectively went through two rounds of interviews with a panel. Most of the questions are behavioural in nature so there are a lot of "what if" scenarios.  The panel would take turns asking the questions. There is also a skills test before you can even get to the interview process.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you had multiple deadlines at the same time?

title: Institutional Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Three stage interview process
1. At home pre-interview evaluation utilizing excel to run analysis, generate reports and graphics and communicate the results in a summary
2. 1 Hour In person interview
3. In person 30-min skill test using excel to do generate similar analysis
Interview Questions: Which skill listed in the job description is your strongest.

title: Seasonal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly and relaxing all questions related to the course and discussion was casual.
Interview was conducted by manager and course teacher. Discussion of student expectation and course expectation detailed. Information about the school was also given and brief discussion of my previous experience was also discussed. Questions about teaching resources and preparation was also asked.
Interview Questions: How long have you been this course before?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took about 3 weeks to get back to me through a phone call interview. I interviewed at UOIT a few days later in March 2019
Interview Questions: what is the biggest issue you have faced when working on a project and how did you fix it?

title: Invigilator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online after a few weeks I was requested to come in and interview in person.  I got a call three weeks later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: What do you do if you are having technical issues with Blackboard?

title: Faculty Services Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a 40 minute interview. Three person panel interview with standard questions about why I want to work there and what I would do in different scenarios. Completed testing for Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Powerpoint after the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about why you want to work here.

title: Teaching Assistantship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UOIT in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process, in this case it is base on merit, and they primarily look at your academic performance during your regular classes. This is a job done mostly by students from the university.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: University Works Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Wasn't really an interview; talked about my skills, what would be expected of me, changes made to the lab during the summer, who is in charge of the labs, what hours I would work, etc.. A week later, I got an offer in the email. Please note there were no technical questions asked
Interview Questions: What are your skills?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fairly simple.  No overly difficult questions and everyone was very nice.  I was treated with respect and they were easy to talk to.  There was one interview, that lasted about one hour
Interview Questions: Tell us what makes you a good candidate for the role?

title: Recruitment Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UOIT
Interview Descriptions: Was a Panel Interview, the entire interview was a 5 min presentation about your experience at the university (if you attended). Then asked about 5-10 min of questions like situational questions. They also asked, why you felt suitable for the role. How you would be able to attract potential students to attend the institution. Where do you see yourself in 5 years? They also asked some technical questions regarding the school protocol for recruitment (101, 105 applicants).
Interview Questions: If you were stuck in an elevator with a stranger and they ask you what UOIT is, what would you reply given only 30 seconds?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UOIT (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was on the phone. My employer knew me from a meeting before.  I was approached for the job.  He explained the project to me and asked me if I was available for the job. I didn't reside in Toronto where the employer was located but I was offered to work from my location since the project mostly required online work.
Interview Questions: What and how I could contribute to the project?

title: Teaching and Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UOIT
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted directly with the professor. He inquired if I'm willing to be engaged in the research and whether or not I would be devoted to pursuing the research  in the conditions provided by the lab.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to conduct research at UOIT?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: get an interview and if the professor is okay with you , you hear back very quick. its 1st come 1st pick. they want to know if you are compatible and can handle the work they give you. can you use the needed programs for the work etc.
Interview Questions: they differ for each project

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UOIT
Interview Descriptions: Interview process really depends on your overall achievements as a student. If you have a strong GPA and work ethics, you can most likely land the job. It helps in the professor to get funding.
Interview Questions: Do you plan to do a master's?

title: Summer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UOIT (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was invited for a phone interview followed by an in person interview. I was sent a request over the email that gave me the location and time of the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you want this job?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Start to the end was very simple and short. Interviews were conducted by lots of students or coops. Friendly. The process went without any issues. I would like to try again in the future. The process went without any issues and im pretty happy about it.
Interview Questions: How would you see yourself in 5 years

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UOIT in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I have applied from Bangladesh through online and then got a reply from one professor at UOIT. I was very much interested in joining his lab and he gave me one day for Skype interview. On that day he asked me about my experience and research interest and also showed me a positive attitude and then I applied for that graduate research assistant position at UOIT.
Interview Questions: Regarding my educational background, research experience, teaching experience.

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very informal, the manager was friendly and showed up late. I liked that they offered free food and free drinks. My stomache was satisfied but my wallet was not.
Interview Questions: What is your favourite colour?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got asked by the professor of the course I took to be his teaching assistant. Pretty straightforward, didn't have to go through any interview processes. Was hired on the spot when I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: If I was interested in the position?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UOIT in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Didn't really have an actual interview apart from providing proper cover letter to my advisor and bit of email communication afterwards. Received a response back from him within several weeks, and afterwards just applied on their website.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Junior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Apply on the school career website and then next day got a telephone interview. Two days later an offer was issue and i accept it. Whole process was less then a week.
Interview Questions:
First Question: Tell me about yourself? 
Second Question: Why you want this job? 
Third Question: When could you start?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UOIT (Oshawa, ON) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Professor asked in class if anybody wanted to do research with him should contact him and then the professor did a GPA check and asked other professors about my performance in their classes and after that employed me to work with him.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous knowledge about working with finite element softwares
